### Version history

This page provides information about older or alternative versions of  indicative distribution map for this ecosystem functional group [**{{< meta params.efgname >}}**](/efg-info/M1_2.qmd).
Check the current maps [here](/map-info/M1_2_valid.qmd).

- Web navigation (**code: M1.2.web.orig**, version v2.1) discarded 
 - Indicative Map (**code: M1.2.IM.orig**, version v2.0) discarded 
 - Indicative Map (**code: M1.2.IM.orig**, version v1.0) discarded 
 - Web navigation (**code: M1.2.WM.nwx**, version v1.0) in preparation 
 - Web navigation (**code: M1.2.web.orig**, version v1.0) requires review 

### Datasets

Datasets considered for previous versions of the indicative map

- **GSFM-2014** (Harris PT et al. 2014).
 - **Kelpforest-list** (Steneck et al. 2002).
 - **Kelpforest-list** (Wernberg and Filbee-Dexler 2019).
 - **Kelpforest-potential-dist** (Jayathilake and Costello 2020).
 - **MEOW-2008** (Spalding MD et al.  2008).
 - **SRTM30-PLUS-V11** (Becker et al. 2009).
 - **NA** (Wernberg and Filbee-Dexler 2019).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset                   |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|:-------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

:::

### Available files

You can download geospatial data for older versions of these maps from the following sources:

**M1.2.web.orig** (v2.1): [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M1_2_web_orig){target="gisdata"}

**M1.2.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](10.5281/zenodo.3546514){target="gisdata"}

**M1.2.web.orig** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/M1.2.web.orig_topo.json){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

But see details of dataset licenses below:

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

## References

References used in these versions of the maps.

- Wernberg T, Filbee-Dexter K (2019) *Missing the marine forest for the trees* **Mar Ecol Prog Ser** 612:209-215 [DOI:10.3354/meps12867](http:dx.doi.org/10.3354/meps12867) 
 - Dinusha R.M. Jayathilake, Mark John Costello (2020) *A modelled global distribution of the kelp biome* **Biological Conservation** 252: 108815 [DOI:10.1016/j.biocon.2020.108815](http:dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.biocon.2020.108815) 
 - Spalding MD, Fox HE, Allen GR, Davidson N, Ferdaña ZA, Finlayson M, Halpern BS, Jorge MA, Lombana A, Lourie SA, Martin KD, McManus E, Molnar J, Recchia CA, Robertson J (2007) *Marine ecoregions of the world: a bioregionalization of coastal and shelf areas*. **Bioscience** 57: 573–583. DOI:[10.1641/B570707](https://doi.org/10.1641/B570707)
  
 - Becker JJ, Sandwell DT, Smith WHF, Braud J, Binder B, Depner J, Fabre D, Factor J, Ingalls S, Kim S-H, Ladner R, Marks K, Nelson S, Pharaoh A, Trimmer R, Von Rosenberg J, Wallace G, Weatherall P (2009) *Global Bathymetry and Elevation Data at 30 Arc Seconds Resolution: SRTM30_PLUS*, **Marine Geodesy** 32: 355-371. DOI:[10.1080/01490410903297766](https://doi.org/10.1080/01490410903297766) 
 - Steneck RS, Graham MH, Bourque BJ, Corbett D, Erlandson JM, Estes JA, Tegner MJ (2002) *Kelp forest ecosystems - biodiversity, stability, resilience and future*. In: **Environmental Conservation** 29: 436–459. 
 - Harris PT, Macmillan-Lawler M, Rupp J, Baker EK (2014) *Geomorphology of the oceans*. **Marine Geology** 352: 4-24. [10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011)
